post.body: This is just unbeliavable. Dude decided to make the internet again with some improvements.
I just wonder is it even possible to make some sort of streaming service like an ZeroNet radio or something alike? Since it's all p2p and nothing is stored while streaming.

For fans of 90s rave and jungle, there are tons of digitalized tape recordings published on this site. But I have to say I don't know to what extent the copyrights go.
http://artmeetsscience.co.uk/tapes/

Now this got me seriously thinking.
There are no server costs, domains are fairly cheap and website can be published even without one, are ads still legit in this environment? If not will the only way to pay for content with donations(patreon-like)? I know people making the internet in 80s couldn't imagine what happend to it within couple years. I was a part of several promissing things that failed and I really hope zeronet won't be one of them. I mean who uses ello? And what a boom it was back then. I don't even know if it still works.
Is there any Wiki I can clone and start building new one? 0list and ZeroName really misses a search feature..
Working on an [OpenTTD ZeroWiki](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ApGGv8DWpuHvzhCqRBvqG4dq5Xb5CV74i/?Page:home) if anyone's interested.

Today I've finished the [Tutorial](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ApGGv8DWpuHvzhCqRBvqG4dq5Xb5CV74i/?Page:tutorial) in the [OpenTTD ZeroWiki](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ApGGv8DWpuHvzhCqRBvqG4dq5Xb5CV74i/?Page:home) as well as all [industries](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ApGGv8DWpuHvzhCqRBvqG4dq5Xb5CV74i/?Page:industries) in temperate climate.

Markdowns usually cannot handle tables properly and Zeronet markdown is no different.

So if anyone needs it, use monospace characters (four spaces on beginning of the line) and count spaces. Like this.

    Examplary table
    1x1 | 2x1 | 3x1
    1x2 | 2x2 | 3x2
    1x3 | 2x3 | 3x3

EDIT: Seems like there's a different markdown for ZeroMe and ZeroWiki..  interesting. Four spaces in Zerome is quote and Zerowiki is for monochrome.

Okay guys, I need to rename one site on my wiki and I have no clue how. There are no files in my ZeroBundle/ZeroNet/data/1ApGGv8DWpuHvzhCqRBvqG4dq5Xb5CV74i
How are those wiki pages stored??

comment.body: @tkarita: Well I can't really imagine an internet radio that would be decentralized.

@Klaus JÃ³nsson Zimmermann: It really looks like the old methods of making money on the web are not going to work with the new environment. Hopefully this will survive long enough for us to find out how will people adapt to it and how 'it' will adapt to the users. I mean it's amazing that all of this came up from one person.

@Dxtjgxz: If there are no money to be made (except for the local userdata that could be sold for one reason or another) large companies won't have any desire even to touch Zeronet. It'll be completely community-driven. But only time will show
@Quadrangle: Thank you it's far from being done
Reddit is mostly open source so you can use that.

@Mynameislegion: This one is how ZeroWiki works (http://127.0.0.1:43110/138R53t3ZW7KDfSfxVpWUsMXgwUnsDNXLP/?Page:zerowikiformat) click on edit to see source. I don't know about the others. Didn't experiment all that much yet.
EDIT: no markdown in replies.. -___-
I appreciate it. Feedback is welcome. There isn't much content to speak of yet, though
@Jayofthezero: Oh I see.. interesting way to store pages. I kinda like it.
@Jayofthezero: Well now I found and edited all the parts but I guess I need to push it and update somehow.
